overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains an active presence on Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, focusing on research related to social media analysis, disinformation, and coordinated inauthentic behavior. LinkedIn has the largest follower base, while Bluesky exhibits the highest engagement rate among recent posts. The overall social media strategy revolves around disseminating research findings, announcing job/research opportunities, and participating in academic discussions.

contentThemes.description: Research, detection, and analysis of coordinated inauthentic behavior and disinformation campaigns on social media platforms.
Application of computational methods and data science techniques to study social phenomena.
Announcements related to research grants, job openings, and opportunities for students in related fields.

recommendations: Cross-promote content across platforms to reach a wider audience.
Use platform-specific hashtags to increase discoverability (e.g., on Bluesky and Mastodon).
Engage with comments and questions to foster a stronger sense of community.
Experiment with different content formats (e.g., videos, infographics) to increase engagement.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky demonstrates strong engagement through reposts, indicating a receptive audience for sharing research and opportunities. Focus on sharing research outputs and fostering community discussion.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon has lower engagement compared to other platforms. Experiment with different posting styles and focus on sharing content relevant to the AOIR community.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn has the largest follower base, but engagement is driven primarily by likes and comments on announcements related to grants and hiring. Maintain a professional tone and share career-related updates.

topPerformingContent.content: Excited to announce that our research team has been awarded a new grant to study information operations across social media platforms.
